docs.text: prefect-docker Welcome! Prefect integrations for working with Docker Getting Started Python setup Requires an installation of Python 3.7+. We recommend using a Python virtual environment manager such as pipenv, conda or virtualenv. These tasks are designed to work with Prefect 2.0. For more information about how to use Prefect, please refer to the Prefect documentation . Installation Install prefect-docker with pip : pip install prefect-docker Write and run a flow from prefect import flow from prefect_docker.tasks import ( goodbye_prefect_docker , hello_prefect_docker , ) @flow def example_flow (): hello_prefect_docker goodbye_prefect_docker example_flow () Resources If you encounter any bugs while using prefect-docker , feel free to open an issue in the prefect-docker repository. If you have any questions or issues while using prefect-docker , you can find help in either the Prefect Discourse forum or the Prefect Slack community . Development If you'd like to install a version of prefect-docker for development, clone the repository and perform an editable install with pip : git clone https://github.com/PrefectHQ/prefect-docker.git cd prefect-docker/ pip install -e ".[dev]" # Install linting pre-commit hooks pre-commit install
docs.title: Home

docs.text: from prefect import flow from prefect_docker.tasks import ( goodbye_prefect_docker , hello_prefect_docker , ) @flow def example_flow (): hello_prefect_docker goodbye_prefect_docker example_flow ()

docs.text: If you'd like to install a version of prefect-docker for development, clone the repository and perform an editable install with pip : git clone https://github.com/PrefectHQ/prefect-docker.git cd prefect-docker/ pip install -e ".[dev]" # Install linting pre-commit hooks pre-commit install

docs.text: prefect_docker.flows This is an example flows module hello_and_goodbye Sample flow that says hello and goodbye! Source code in prefect_docker/flows.py 7 8 9 10 11 12 13 14 @flow def hello_and_goodbye (): """ Sample flow that says hello and goodbye! """ print ( hello_prefect_docker ) print ( goodbye_prefect_docker ) return "Done"
